item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

i am interested in interfaces bc of the same reason i am interested in authenticity + individualism - i think every product has a very unique value prop and inner core sense and the ability of the interface to convey the affordances tat suggest potential use cases of the product relies on a balance of storytelling, candor, and efficacy friction is a lever of timing in order to control the user interface buttons + interface features like modal popups are ways to abstract certain actions disclose information with hierarchy abstract by finding patterns and relationships Design representations that are both accurate and evocative aesthetic coherence The most beautiful interfaces for complex systems often feel like well-designed maps‚Äîthey orient users, suggest paths, reveal landmarks, but ultimately empower exploration rather than dictating a single route.

every relationship is either a soft shell or hard shell fruit soft shell, soft inside - fuyu persimmons - burst at the seams aka you make me feel so much and i feel so close to you i will literally overflow with conversation raspberries - the most tender fruit that still needs to be hand-picked hard shell, soft inside - pomegranates harder to crack, but when it opens its jolting and surprising bananas - also burst at the open, but the hard shell makes it mushy and leak out weirdly regardless of a hard shell, if my feelings are left to rot inside, they will inevitably spill out i am embarassed when i hold in my emotions too long and they inevitably ooze out forgive me, the mess i reveal of myself at ripening.

item.title: 23: On Golden Light and Growing
item.description: The winter darkness stings deeper in February, the type of bone-chill that clutches in lemmas of stillness. But I was born on a rare 72-degree day in early March‚Äîmy mom entering the hospital with a bright yellow jacket and swollen anticipation, both of which she could shed away.
im starting to get it, now. at some point we reach a carrying capacity at how far our ambitions can grow.

item.title: goodreads redesign
item.description: problems: as an avid reader disconnected from my friends its hard for me to maintain digital book clubs scheduling issues remembering the book we discussed as a poetry lover its hard for me to find fellow poetry lovers online im reading too many books at once difficult to discuss think pieces together finding ppl interested -> sending them article -> reading it / dissecting it together ideas: feature to sync up reading amongst devices accountability tracker (nudge ppl to read) find other ppl reading same book as u to chat creating a book club with other people recommending books based on someone‚Äôs book tastes discovery for new books

item.title: tokens of happiness
item.description: started 10/17/23 painting pumpkins with other students calling katherine & seeing her face & her saying she loved my voice going to the black diamond & seeing the light fill the space reminds me of that quote from a little life on how the light on a subway is restorative when my graphic design teacher commented im good at seeing connections the shadows of leaves on european facades talking w stepho and texting her throughout the day putting on a sweater BEST pizza ever at baest rooming w michelle: dont have to worry about being lonely 10/31/23

item.title: unused urban spaces
item.description: unused urban spaces #urbanism some plazas attract a lot of ppl in nyc ‚Äî most dont some are only used for walking across most ppl who use plazas are young office workers from nearby plazas change way of life best used plazas are sociable places higher than average proportion of women in most used place women going is good signal ppl gravitate towards lots of ppl ppl dont rlly choose to stand in the middle of a large place preference for pillars movement thru space patterns not specific to nyc ‚Äî based on other societies jan gehl‚Äôs study of self-congestion ‚Äî mapped patterns similar here “Contrary to ‘common sense’ expectations,” Ciolek notes, “the great majority of people were found to select their sites for social interaction right on or very close to the traffic lines intersecting the plaza.
